article.headline: Banks stocks sink after report of alleged widespread money-laundering activities
article.body: Bank stocks took a broad hit in premarket trading Monday, after reports were published alleging many major banks continued doing business with customers despite suspecting money-laundering activities. The SPDR Financial Select Sector ETF XLF, +0.11% dropped 2.8% ahead of the open, underperforming the selloff in the broader stock market, as futures YM00, +0.82% for the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% fell 528 points, or 1.9%. Among some of the financial ETF's more heavily weighted components, shares of J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. JPM, -0.57% slid 4.9%, Bank of America Corp. BAC, +0.47% shed 3.8%, Citigroup Inc. C, +0.47% declined 4.4% and Well Fargo & Co. WFC, lost 3.5%.
